I know that I'm going to get criticized for saying these things, but they're the truth. I cannot fathom how one can simply shut off other people when things don't turn out right. God works in mysterious ways, I guess. Have you ever wondered that? What God has in store, why he does certain things? It just confuses me to no end how some things will work for good. Nobody's perfect, and we all have to realize that. Another thing I cannot understand: Uncontrollable anger. Why do people blow up? I have felt the anger bubble up inside me, and I feel the rage trying to come out, but I simply don't let it. I just don't understand it sometimes. I can't wait 'till Guys and Dolls. Hmmm... Good show tonight! And a good cast party @ Applebees. But, as pertaining to my tradition, I have penned a poem. It's actually not sad, or angry. A bit melancholy if I may, but it has a good tone overall. Oh, and by the way, don't read anything into it. When inspiration strikes, you cannot alter its course. This poem was composed with a sleep-deprived and adrenaline-pumped mind. Hurray for random Inspiration! Why does the light draw itself to the darkness, The glittering star loses itself in the night. Just out of reach, kept away on a whim, I am not allowed, I cannot hold the star. Although I have a light of my own, My eyes are eclipsed by a star just as bright But still I am held, by the pull of my star. Tho' in my dreams I am warmed by the light Of the spark'ling star, as it dances in my mind: Fading in and out of my grasp, I feel as though I disturb the star, In it's glorious orbit about its own world, For its world only touches mine in one place A tiny instance in the Grand scheme Shine, Shine without me Hm... It seems a bit proper for me. I usually have a slightly more casual tone to my poems. Who knows... This one was kind-of inspired by a few things. After reflecting upon this.. Especially with my less-than-substantial knowledge of most people's mannerisms. Ah well. "For all that may come true, we must continue to hope, to hope for something new, something better, something perfect, or else all that is human is lost." He fingered the knife. Something told him that this was the right thing to do... the resolution to his problem... to everyone's problem. But did he have the courage? One thrust, and it would all be fixed. Painless, and easy. One stab through the heart. He had made sure to prepare for the monumentous event, he wrote letters to everyone, telling each that they were not to blame. His family, he knew, would cry, would mourn him, but the rising cost of college and his father's unemployment made this a better solution. But what about everyone... everything he was leaving behind? He had a beautiful girl... No, wait, nevermind that. She was gone, without a hope for him. It had been a terrible fight with his best friend... and he hadn't seen either of them in over a week. He thought about everything he had ever done... sitting quietly on the floor. in a moment of fury, he thrust the knife into his chest. The blood flowed freely in his mind... He reached his hand down to where the would should have been... it was not there. He had only imagined it... The phone began to ring, but he did not pick it up. With tears falling freely from his eyes, he looked over the note he had written. He fingered an envelope, with a girl's name written on it... he shakily opened it and read what he had written to his love. He finished reading the neatly folded sheet, took the knife in his hand, and flung it into the wall. Breathing heavily, as though he had just run a race, he walked out he door, and down the hall. The phone continued to ring. He picked it up, and cleared his throat, to try and sound normal... Must life go on, when conflict is surly ahead? Don't worry... I'm not writing about myself. I'm not suicidal. But I wish I could get away from it all, I wish something would work out for me... Selfish wishes bring only greif. I love her. I don't care what anyone says. But I have no chance anymore... But there is a slight chance. And may I be stricken dead if I do not take that chance. Take That Chance. I'd rather have you as a friend than not at all.
